page.title: 14TRADE.
page.content: Commercial activities are carried out in a small way at the Beecraigs Centre. In the centre there are soft goods such as fluffy toys and oven gloves shaped like trout.Visitors can also buy homemade jam and pickles, books ,pencils and pictures. The biggest money making efforts concern the trout farm and the deer farm. The trout is grown to a particular size and then sold to the public in two ways.It is possible for the general public to buy fresh trout on a Sunday. Some trout is sold to the deep-freeze companies and more is sold to hotels far and wide. Venison from the deer is also sold from the park. Most of this goes to butchers and to hotels.
